title: Footballers' Wives musical is in the works and we can't wait
text:
Footballers’ Wives is being turned into a musical (Picture: SHED)

With the Coleen Rooney versus Rebekah Vardy WAG war still waging, now’s seems as good a time as any to bring Footballers’ Wives back into our lives.

However, the hit drama won’t be returning in the form of more episodes, but rather a brand new musical.

Yep, that’s right, Christmas has well and truly come early as we’ll soon get to see Tanya Turner’s messy marriage to Jason Turner played out on stage with bitchy ballads and a wealth of dance numbers to match.

According to RadioTimes.com, the production is ‘unlikely to feature the main cast of Footballers’ Wives, with workshopping for casting beginning at the end of the year – with a view to hitting theatres in 2020.’

Original co-creator Maureen Chadwick confirmed that she is heading the project, with Kath Gotts creating the music and lyrics.

The musical is set to follow Tanya’s (left) story (Picture: ITV)

It still remains up in the air as to whether Footballers’ Wives will return to television but producer Liz Lake confessed she would jump at the opportunity.

‘If there’s an appetite for it, and enough people want it, it would be worth having that conversation,’ she added to the publication.

‘Whatever job I do, I get people telling me they loved Footballers’ Wives. It was an escape and a bit of refreshing camp, but it was still really bold storytelling.

‘I think we’d prefer to have an update than a reboot, a revival moving it forward. It’s more than just nostalgia, it’s about seeing what life is like now.’

Footballers’ Wives ran for five series on ITV from 2002 to 2006.

Zoe Lucker portrayed iconic character Tanya, with Cristian Solimeno playing her husband Jason.

Over the years the show saw some truly wild times televised to the nation, including extramarital and same-sex affairs, death by a champagne bottle and even a very problematic baby swap scandal.
